title: Great Place to Stay in Greece
text: We were on a Land Tour in Greece and one of the hotels we stayed in was The Amalia Hotel. It is a very big hotel with a few buildings. It is beautiful hotel and a well appointed hotel to stay. The staff were friendly, the rooms were nice including the bathrooms and very clean. The food was good. There is a town near by the sea. The town is worth seeing.We would stay there again and recommend this hotel.

title: A Must See In Greece
text: This is a place you must see when traveling in Greece. It is just amazing the workmenship of people of many centries ago.

title: Something To See
text: You won't believe your eyes of the things that were built so many years ago. Site worth seeing. Take the whole family and learn about such great history.

title: Athens Experience
text: We went on a Land Tour to Greece. One of the hotels we stayed in was the Zafolia Hotel on Alexandras Ave. It is a 4 star hotel. Good location, friendly staff, nice rooms and good breakfast. On our Land Tour we stayed in this hotel 3 different times. If we ever get back to Athens again we would stay there. We recommend this hotel.

title: We came Back Again
text: Our first visit to The Holiday was May 2017. We came back again in November 2018 on the way home from a cruise. It is still the nice place it was back in 2017. I will say it again. The hotel is clean. The rooms and bath are well appointed. The staff are friendly. The breakfast was good and a great location. Near Old Town, the Outlets, Interstate 95 and may restaurants. It is a good place to stay. My husband and I recommend this hotel to everyone.
place: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Saint Augustine North

title: Good Pizza
text: My husband and I with my friend who lives in St. Augustine went to Borrillo's in November 2018. We have been there several times in the past. They make their own pizza dough on site. A variety menu for all. The prices are average. It is not a fancy place but if you want good pizza this is the place to go. And the locals go there too such as my friend. It is located on the main street in St Augustine. The staff are friendly. We recommend this place for good food.
place: Borrillo's Pizzeria and Beer & Wine Garden

title: Something For Everyone
text: We have been dealing with Kay's since 2006 in the Caribbean. Our last visit was November 2018. I tell people if you can't find something you like at Kay's then there is something wrong with you. They have the most beautiful jewelry and a wide selection. They are nice people to deal with. You do not get pressured to buy something like some other jewelry stores do. Their prices are good and you get treated well. My husband and I recommend Kay's Fine Jewelry to everyone.

title: Something for Everyone
text: In May, my husband and I were Krakow, Poland. We visited The Cloth Hall. Everything that is for sale has been made in Poland. The craftmenship is wonderful on all of the products. Great place to pick up a gift for someone or yourself. Outside in the Town Square, there cafes set up for eating or drinking. I was impressed with the beauty of the flowers that surround these cafes. It was a nice touch. On one of the side streets leading to the square is a bakery. The display case almost sits of the sidewalk and is lined with a variety of delicious looking donuts. There are a number of places to shop, get coffee or sit and enjoy the day in the Town Square. I recommend the area and would visit again when in Krakow.

title: Fly The Friendly Skies
text: We had direct round trip flights The planes were on time. The food was good and the crew were very nice on both flights. And our luggage was not lost! Would fly United again.

title: Never Again Would Stay
text: My husband and I did a land tour and one of the hotels we stayed in was Plaza Alto Hotel in Prague. I requested a shower and traded with the coach driver with the approval of the desk clerk. Our room was sub standard. Night table next to bed was missing. We went to the desk. As I approached the desk, the women desk clerk looked at me and said "you are the women who had to have a shower" in a loud and nasty voice. Then the male clerk started shouting in a loud and nasty voice "you got a shower what more do you want"? I asked nicely if I could have a night table for my side of the bed. You could see that at one time there was a table from the indentations in the carpet. The male desk clerk kept yelling. I told him this is no was to treat guests. As I walked away the female clerk yelled "you can't have a table from the lobby". We have traveled for many years and have stayed in many hotels and have never been treated like this. It has never occurred to me to ask for a lobby table or receive one. I did not tell them that our TV did not work or the toilet seat was falling off. I waited for the night clerk to come on duty and told him about the toilet seat. He said someone would be there in the morning to fix it. It was never fixed and we were there for 2 days. In the morning our coach group and other guests were having breakfast in the dining room. When one of our fellow tour guests asked the busboy if he would clean off a table since there was no other place to sit. His response was to yell"OK, OK, OK". This was disruptive to the other guests trying to eat their breakfast. These people need a course in How To Treat Hotel Guests. We do not recommend this hotel to anyone and we will never stay there again.

title: Close to everything and Good Eats
text: May of this year (2018) my husband and I were in Vienna. We happened to come across this great place to eat. It is near hotels, shopping and the train. We ordered the Potato Soup with mushrooms and bacon. It was very good! The food prices were average for this area. The service was good and the waiter was friendly. You can eat outside under large umbrellas or inside. The place was clean, bright and cheerful. There is a large menu selection. They have menus for several languages. We recommend this restaurant and would go again.

title: Will Go Back Again
text: This was our first time staying at this hotel. The room and bath were well appointed and clean. The bed was comfortable which always helps to make a stay good. The breakfast was good. Friendly staff. Easy check in and out. Close to Interstate 95 and the outlets. Not far from old town St. Augustine. We would stay again in this hotel.
place: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Saint Augustine North

title: All Cracker Barrels Are The Same
text: We have eaten at many Cracker Barrels in different states. They are all the same. Good food and a nice store. Family friendly.

title: Always Been a Good Place to Stay and Is
text: As I have written many times in the past about the Sleep Inn & Suites we have not been disappointed. We were there the end of May, 2017. The hotel is very clean, the beds are comfortable, the staff are very friendly and the breakfast is good. Easy check in and out. Near I 95, the outlets and many restaurants. I have recommended this hotel to many friends and their families and they feel the same as we do. We will back again.
place: Sleep Inn & Suites Smithfield Near I-95

title: Good Italian Food
text: Yesterday, May 10, 2016 my husband and I went to the Olive Garden for lunch.Lunch times are 11am to 4pm. Dinner starts at 4pm. The staff are very friendly and the service is always good. This is one of our favorite places to go for good Italian food. The menu has a good variety of foods including a "light fair", all you can eat warm bread, soup or salad. They have a take out also. The prices are good. I usually have to have a take home box for my food. This is a family place and not fancy dress up. It has always been clean.The food is delicious! I recommend this restaurant to eveyone.

title: nice place to eat
text: Yesterday, May 7, 2016 we visited the restaurant for dinner. Got a table right away. There were 4 adults and 1 child. There is a good selection of food on the menu. The staff are very friendly. The food was good and priced average. Nice family place. The locals go there a lot, so you know it must be good. It is not a fancy place so you do not have to dress up. It was clean. There is a bar in another part away from the diningroom. You can sit out back by the parking lot too. They also cater affairs. The restaurant is in the area I live. I recommend this place to everyone. If you are in the area stop in. I do not know the hours of operation.

title: Very Nice Place to Stay in Ireland
text: February, 2016 we took a guided tour of Ireland. The 1st hotel we stayed in was the Newpark Hotel in Kilkenny. The room was very nice with a view of the gardens through large to floor windows. The bathroom was state of the art. The room, bath and whole hotel was decorated well. Large lobby with a fireplace. The staff were very friendly and could not help you enough. The breakfast buffet was everything that you would want. Diningroom service was very good and tables had white tablecloths. I don't know if there is a charge for breakfast because it was included in our tour. I recommend this hotel to everyone. Only one night stay but would go back for a longer time. We did not get to see the town because it was dark when we took the short walk to dinner. There is a shopping mall in town. Very enjoyable one night stay. Comfortable beds.

title: sweaters for everyone
text: February, 2016 we took a guided tour of Ireland. One of the stops was Blarney Woolen Mills. They have the most beautiful sweaters you have ever seen. Rack after rack of them. Gift shop with all things Ireland. I recommend this stop when in the area. There is a hotel and restaurant there also. Blarney Castle is just a short walk from there.

title: Nice place and good food
text:
The Mill Restaurant is next door to The Blarney
Woolen Mills (hotel there too). It is cafeteria style with good good and good service. A wide variety of food to choose from. Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. The is also a kitchen store for those who want to shop. I recommend The Mill to everyone.

title: Nice hotel in center of town
text: February, 2016 we took a guided tour of Ireland. We stayed in the hotel 2 nights. It is located in the center of town. Easy short walk to shops and restaurants. Hotel has a diningroom. We had breakfast and dinner there. Non guests can eat too for a price. The food was good. The staff were friendly and service was good. It is self service but they will bring you coffee or tea to your table. The room was very nice and the bed was comfortable. I recommend this hotel to everyone when in the area.

title: Something from Ireland for everyone
text: Carrolls Irish Gift Stores are all over Dublin. This is the place for all your gifts for other people and yourself. They have I think just about everything you would want Irish to take home. Tee shirts, sweatshirts, mugs, music, food, authentic & traditional Irish Jewelry, etc etc. The store is worth the shopping. You won't have to go out of your way to find a store. Just look in the next block. We go to Carrolls every time we are in Dublin. I recommend this store to everyone who wants good prices and take home gifts of Ireland.

title: Not nice
text: We stayed here on the way back from a cruise. The hotel website said there were outlets near by. This is the main reason we booked this hotel. When checking in the desk clerk said the outlets had been closed for 20 yrs. Reading the room booklet also advertised outlets near. Desk clerk said that book was new. There is nothing to do or see in this town. Couple fast food places and a Cracker Barrel. The bathroom door in our room opened into the room and in front of the room door. Door was on a spring so you could not keep it open. Desk clerk said to put the ottoman in door way to hold open. When bathroom door was open you could not get into the room from the hallway. The whole hotel inside and out was painted sickly beige and drab brown. Depressing looking. The hotel was old. Breakfast average. Would NEVER stay again.Toilet when flushed sounded like a Industrial waste management plant. It was so loud. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Room was not guest friendly.

title: Not only for history buffs
text: The battlefield is located on Route 20 in Orange County, VA. Easy in and out parking. I live in the area so sometimes I see a park ranger there to guide you through the large map. I do not know when the rangers are scheduled to be there. You could ask at the welcome center just off Route 3 in Fredericksburg. The area is large and you can walk it. They even have a Johnny on the spot there near the shelter and parking.

title: Locals love this place
text: This is a family run eat in or take out restaurant. We have taken out many times over the years. As a matter fact we had take out from here just last week (April 21st). The food is very good and the prices are good too. The husband and wife are very friendly people. It is not fancy but it is clean. The locals go there a lot. It is located right on Route 20 in a strip mall in Orange County. Easy access in and out of parking lot. I live in this area.

title: Right on the road
text: Mamas Pizza is in a strip mall right on Route 20 in Orange County. Easy to get to from road. The place is clean and the food is good. Prices are good too. If the locals go there you know it has to be good. It is not fancy so come as you are. You order the food at the counter and when it is ready someone will bring it to your table. Friendly people. Have eaten there several times. Have not only pizza but other foods....Italian food, subs etc. I think there is something for everyone. This is the area in which I live.

title: Never Again
text: We stayed here 1 night on our way to board a cruise ship. Have never been there before and will never again. There are no towel racks in the bathrooms so we used the pinch hangers in the closet. Desk clerk said none of the rooms have them. The suites furniture and carpet were dark brown and depressing looking. The bathroom walls were painted a sickly looking yellow. The breakfast was average but the coffee was very weak. The desk service was good. There is a indoor pool but we did not use it. Close to Interstate 95 and restaurants.

title: Would stay again
text: We stayed here 1 night on the way to boarding a cruise ship. Close to Interstate 95 and restaurants. Friendly staff, easy check in and out. The breakfast was good but there was no artificial sweetener. I asked and the answer was no. Had outdoor pool, guest laundry, no coffee in lobby but coffee maker in rooms. My pillows were flat so I had to put 2 together. My husband said his were not. The bathroom had only 1 small bottle of shampoo, no lotion or conditioner.
place: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Ft. Pierce

title: across the street from airport and not far from cruise port
text: We stayed here the night before our cruise. The staff were very friendly and check in and out was easy. They have shuttle service to cruise port and airport. The in coming airplanes fly right over the hotel to the landing strip. You can almost see the people on the planes. This did not bother us. It was kind of fun to see the planes up close. The room was average. Our air conditioner broke twice and was fixed. They have gated parking for those who want to leave their cars there while traveling. I believe there is a charge for this. The bathroom sink was outside of the room that housed the toilet and tub. The sink was not user friendly due to having almost no space to put your things. Our toilet seat was falling off but the maintenance man was gone for the night. So i fixed it myself. Breakfast was average.

title: Always stay there on the way home
text: We have stayed at this hotel for many years now and have always found it a good place to stay. Good location, friendly staff, easy check in and out. Nice outdoor pool. I have written reviews about this hotel before but wanted to write again because we are pleased with the rooms, staff and location. The breakfast is good and no cost. The rooms are guest friendly and the hotel is always clean.
place: Best Western Plus St. Augustine I-95

title: Has gone down hill
text:
We always eat in this Cracker Barrel when we come into
St. Augustine. In the past the food has been good. I believe it must be under new management because the food was not as good as in the past and not very hot. Said they chicken rice soup but then said they were all out after I ordered it. Wanted soup before rest of food but got food before soup. Was very unsatisfied with this place. Have eaten in many Cracker Barrels.

title: Outlets near Interstate 95
text: The Carolina Outlets are near Interstate 95, many hotels and restaurants in Smithfield, NC. The outlets have many stores with a range of prices I believe for everyone. If you shop outlets you should know what the price is at your home stores to know if you are getting a good deal at the outlets or at home stores. In my opinion outlets do not have the great discount prices they used to. So you should be a wise shopper. Yes, there are many good buys and sometimes there are additional discounts taken off "The Outlet Prices". Including the brand name stores there is also The Carolina Pottery that have most everything you would want. Good shopping there. So if you are in the area, give the outlets a try. Happy shopping!

title: Easy access to Interstate 95
text: We have stayed here before. Easy check in and out. Staff was friendly. Our room was clean as it has always been. The breakfast was good and free. We did have one problem. When we were checking out the room to make sure we did not leave anything we noticed the water pipe under the bathroom sink had come unattached from the sink. If we had used the water at the sink there would have been a flood. Thank goodness it waited till we were leaving. Told the front desk the problem. I am sure they had it fixed right away. We would stay here again.

title: Nice place to stay
text: We have stayed at this Hampton Inn before on our way to taking a cruise from Ft. Lauderdale. Friendly front desk staff. Easy check in and out. Breakfast was good and at no extra cost. This is true at all Hampton Inns. Our room was clean and the beds were good. Hotel located near Interstate 95. We would stay here again.
place: Hampton Inn & Suites of Ft. Pierce

title: Fries are the best
text: This Burger King is just like all the rest. Good fries and burgers. Clean place and and service was fine

title: Food is fine
text: Place was clean. Food was good and would go their again. Close to hotel and other restaurants. Never been to a Sweet Tea Grille before.

title: Good stay before cruise
text: We have stayed here before. We usually stay one night before embarking on a cruise out of Ft. Lauderdale. We would stay again. The front desk staff are very friendly. The hotel was clean as it has always been including our suite. The suites are well appointed. The breakfast was very good and no extra cost to guests. There is a shuttle service to and from the cruise port and the airport. I believe the shuttle service to the cruise port was free but we had to pay $10 each to return to the hotel. A taxi cab would have costed more. We waited only a few minutes at the cruise port for our shuttle. Hotel is located near shopping and restaurants. A good place to stay.
place: Homewood Suites Ft. Lauderdale Airport & Cruise Port

title: Near Outlets
text: We have stayed at this hotel many times on the way back from a cruise. The staff is friendly. The hotel is close to Interstate 95. The outlets are just minutes away. Restaurants are close by. The breakfast was good at no extra cost to guests. The rooms are always clean. We would stay there again.
place: Best Western Plus St. Augustine I-95

title: Great vacation on the Island of Oahu
text: Polynesian Culture Center a fun time for the whole family. Clean, places to eat, 7 island presentations on 42 acres. This is just a short summary. Look up on the internet for more details. Circle Oahu tours. North Shore...eat at Fumi's Kahuku Shrimp farm restaurant. Best shrimp you ever had!! Waikiki Beach great. Pearl Harbor a must. Aloha Stadium, swap meet. A must for souvenirs (all new) and good prices. Diamond Head...what a view! Iolani Palace, only royal palace on US soil. Honolulu Zoo. There is so much to do and see that I do not have enough space to write all. Weather great!! A wonderful place to visit and live if you could. Hope this short summary helps get someone started. ALOHA

title: Pounders, great place to eat
text: pizza good, clean place, service good, prices good. We only had the pizza for lunch but there are other foods on the menu. Think you would like this restaurant one of several restaurants there to eat. There was not anything we disliked about the place.

title: shrimp...good
text: This eating place is located on Kam Hwy. on the North Shore. It is a shrimp farm so the shrimp is fresh every day. Nothing fancy. Eat outside under tent at large picnic tables. Sink to wash hands after eating and bathrooms. Been there several times and will go back again. website...EatOutHawaii.com for menu & coupons. Happy eating!!

title: Great place
text: We got into the airport late at night and the shuttle picked us to take us back to the hotel (which was Aloft...would never stay there again). When we arrived at the hotel to pick up our car the battery was dead. My husband walked over to the Hilton Garden Inn (just next door to the Aloft) and got us a room for the night. The desk clerk was a very friendly lady. The room was very nice. We had breakfast there the next morning...which was very good. It is a buffet. You can pick out your main dish (eggs, pancakes,french toast etc and will be fixed hot for you. The desk clerk in the morning was also a nice person. The staff are friendly and willing to help you in any way they can. We liked the hotel and the staff so much that we have booked 2 more stays there for an upcoming trip. Free shuttle to and from the airport and parking. I forgot to mention that the hotel also offers lunch and dinner for a fee. The hotel was very clean and we would recommend it to everyone.

title: Won't Stay Again
text: We stayed here on our way to Florida for a cruise. The staff was friendly, the location was good (near Interstate 95). The room was terrible....the carpet needed to be replaced...was dirty...would not walk on it without shoes on. There were stains every where on the carpet and a BIG water stain in the corner of the carpet where something had leaked. This was the 2nd Days Inn we stayed in on our way to Florida. We had never stayed at a Days Inn before and will never stay again!!!
place: Days Inn & Suites by Wyndham Savannah North I-95

title: Good Place To Stay
text: My husband and I have stayed at the Sleep Inn and Suites Smithfield 8 times now. Our last visit was December, 2013. We will revisit there again in February. The hotel has a good location. Near eating places and the Carolina Outlets. This Sleep Inn has always been very clean and the staff are friendly and will help you in any way they can. Renovations have just been completed. While we were there the lobby was getting a new floor. We can't wait to get back and see nice it will look. The beds are comfortable and the breakfast area has a good selection of foods. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. Two different times friends were with us and they felt the same way we do. Sleep Inn needs to up date the pictures of the rooms on their web site. I guess they are waiting for the lobby flooring to be completed. The new renovations are very attractive. J and M, Virginia
place: Sleep Inn & Suites Smithfield Near I-95
